page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: The area contains a wide variety of land use , with some forestry , quarrying,a man-made loch created to provide hydro-electricity,National Trust property,and the foremost primary industry,{farming.}Most of the land is part of large estates let to tenant farmers. Always on an important route way between north and south ,the town of {Pitlochry}is serviced by the major trunk road, the A9 ,and by railway. At the last count in 1981 the population was 2196 ,with a slight preponderance of older folk as it is a popular retirement area . { Tourism }provides the main source of employment, while other tertiary industries include the Fresh Water Fisheries Lab. and the Hydro- Electricty Board .The only secondary activity is whisky production.
